alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 19 at 1:48PM MDT until June 19 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING ACROSS WEST CENTRAL AND NORTHWEST PORTIONS OF NEW MEXICO AND THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, HOT TEMPERATURES, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS, CENTRAL HIGHLANDS AND NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Hot, dry, and unstable conditions will continue into this evening and return Tuesday with poor overnight humidity recovery. Breezy to locally windy southwest to west winds will combine with low relative humidity to create several hours of critical fire weather for portions of New Mexico. Any fires that develop will have the potential for rapid fire growth in receptive fuel beds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) until 9 PM MDT this evening and from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with occasional gusts to 40 mph through this evening and again Tuesday afternoon and evening. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 8 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended..
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
